comment: She's a nice person and willing to work with you on assignments and be forgiving, however what I didn't like were the lectures as they seemed to be unfocused most of the time and allowed students to ramble on for too long. Also I recall her saying she didn't like group work at the beginning of the semester, only then to assign a huge one at the end

She's not bad. The homework is pretty easy, as well as the quizzes. Her lectures can get off track sometimes though, so you need to study using the textbook to pass exams. She drops a lot of grades in quizzes, homework, and one exam. Content wise, if you're really into Human Development, I would take someone else since she skips over things.

Kemp was a good professor, her class was very interesting and easy! Course Structure: Textbook assigned, you can get by without it but it was very useful. Lectured by Powerpoint, Quizzes (no camera), Tests (in-person),  and Group Presentation (fun).

Kemp is passionate but kinda disorganized. She is really bad at responding to emails, and her tests feel like shots in the dark unless you study the power points, lectures, AND the textbook. Time is class is fun, there are group projects that are very easy, and her lectures are engaging (but not always on topic)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: You have to read the chapters and STUDY to do well in class, quizzes are open note and representative of tests, attendance is graded, but if something happens she is understanding and nice. There is a group project worth 20% of grade, but is mostly doable in class. Only gripe is lectures not always relevant. Hard class but great prof.

I had Professor Kemp for my first semester and this semester. Honestly, I prefer her in person classes rather than online. I felt like I learned more. The class schedule was a bit disorganised, lots of note-taking, but she was easy to reach, and she drops a LOT of grades. So I would still take her again, overall I think she's great.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: You basically teach yourself. She uses an online textbook platform that has random questions throughout it. There's no lectures or slides provided, it's just all in the text. The tests were on a different platform each time and hard to locate. There's a paper at the end but it wasn't very hard. If you're ok teaching yourself, it's not a bad class.

She is not a bad professor, but she is not an amazing one, either. She goes on random rabbit trails in the lectures and tests things not in the books or the lectures. She is hard to contact when there is confusion. If you are able to contact her, she is very open and helpful in helping you fix things there's confusion.

Loved her. When teaching mindfulness, she bought the class bubbles and brought us outside to use the bubbles to practice mindfulness breathing. Her lectures are very interesting, and she encourages student participation. The PREX assignment (mandatory; semester long) is something all psych classes need to do, but very easy to complete.

I had to withdraw from this course after add/drop as she changed the semester-long project (*after* a/d) to a project involving "body language reading." She began teaching us using Chase Hughes' "training". Feel free to look into Hughes, as he has been thoroughly debunked. It is absurd that this was being taught in a human dev. course classroom.
Dropped this class before the first day because she had mandatory zoom meetings at 9:30am the same day we meet in person at 12:00. There was nothing about these meetings on the registration page...
I loved this class and this professor! She has a great sense of humor and makes the class very interesting. She was great!

This class was so frustrating. She is very unprofessional and spends majority of the lectures rambling or treating class as a therapy session for students that overshare. We had a project that was supposed to be semester-long before she scrapped the entire thing and gave us almost no direction and less than a month for the new one. Do NOT take.
Best professor ive ever had. Just go to class and you'll be good.

This class is easy, the quizzes are multiple attempt and online and the tests aren't difficult, they pull right from the quizzes. However Professor Kemp will ramble during lectures about topics that are completely irrelevant from the material. She does seem nice, but she is inaccessible outside of class and the final project is explained poorly.

Quizzes are NOT like the lectures. Lectures are discussion based and are interesting but only cover a fraction of the material. Reading the textbook is actually very interesting but she is also v disorganized. But she is fun and caring and has tons of experience! You could prob learn more about development with another prof but she's a good option.

Dr. Kemp is amazing! She cares about students and their success. Always takes time to answer questions and give more details. Her tests are based off the powerpoints and mimic the study guide/study session materials. If you have the chance to take her, DO IT! If you show up to class, you will pass!

she's a really good teacher and cares about students as a person. she posts most of the slideshows and makes study guides based on the test herself so you know what to study. tests are super easy and she's very understanding i loved her

I have no clue how her rating is so high, but do not take this professor. Gives the vaguest instructions for all assignments and if you don't complete it up to her standard she will gaslight you into thinking you had clear instructions. Never responds to email and sucks at communicating with students in general about the class. You have been warned

She talks about herself the entire class. Is a terrible communicator and doesn't care about her students. Says attendance is not mandatory, then will grade you for "In-Class Assignments". She will literally not tell you that there is a test and doesn't care. She expects you to read her mind when it comes to grading criteria. Do not take her.

Dr. Kemp is an amazing professor. Her lectures are most of the times just conversation where she goes over the over the ppt's but overall is a pretty laidback class. There is one major project and you just got to show some effort in it and she'll grade leniently. The tests are basically the review so dont miss the class before the test. Chill prof!

Lectures are just her rambling half the time. The rambling can be interesting but never helps you learn the material. Weekly chapter quizzes (sometimes more than 1) and 2 attempts at them. Tests aren't difficult if you attend the review in class. Always extremely vague with instructions then grades as if she told you step by step what to do.

had her for two classes; such an interesting teacher. does not require you to get the textbook bc her P.P are based on them. study guides and review sessions for tests; quizzes are 2 attempts. I don't usually talk much in class but started to just bc she is SO open to everyones opinions and encourages us to engage. One easy project, def take her!

Professor Kemp was okay at first, but then she started claiming that I used AI to write discussions without any evidence for these claims. I also never made 100 on any of the work I did. She is very strict and doesn't help in the slightest.

This professor possesses no professionalism in any capacity of the word. Many of her exams had questions that didnt provide a correct answer as an option, so good luck acing those. Every bit of her instructions for projects are confusing, and if you message her about it, she gives vague clarifications and then ignores you. WARNING! DONT TAKE HER!

How this professor has so many good reviews is beyond me. Her instructions for assignments are terrible, exams are confusing and full of typos, I had to buy two different textbooks when I only needed one because SHE made a mistake. Just awful!! Not to mention that she grades harshly yet refuses to give adequate direction! Never taking her again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Maybe she is better in person, but her communication for online class is awful. It is very unclear when things are due and she does not answer emails to clarify. Slides are useless but the quizzes and tests are easy and come straight from the text book. The project takes hours so start as early as you can even though she explains nothing about it.

You have a bunch of time to complete quizzes and everything was easy. The only complaint is that attendance is mandatory and she talks about random stories the whole time instead of the actual material so going to class felt pointless.

This class has enjoyable lectures... the problem is that the lectures don't help you at all with the work you have to do. So much of the lectures feel like she's bringing up stuff that barely has to do with the material. I'd be okay with this if attendance wasn't mandatory, but it is. Easy class, but bad if you actually are interested in learning.

class was very interesting, one big project which we had complete creative freedom, quizzes for all chapters of the textbook, but they weren't due until the day the test opened, and tests were open until the Sunday before the next week started. very discussion based class, not really much to take notes over, tests are very similar to quizzes!

It was honestly an easy class, but her lectures have nothing to do with the quizzes and tests. You don't even have to pay attention in class but attendance is a grade. You do quizzes each chapter based that goes directly with the textbook and then the quiz questions are word for word on the test. One group project, but super easy and do it in class
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Nothing that she talks about in her "lectures" relates to the assignments or exams, or anything in theories of personality. The textbook is the only reason I did well in this class because the exams were straight from the texts. She also does not respond to emails at all.

Listen, Kemp is definitely easy. However- I have learned nothing from her specifically. I took her because all the reviews said she was easy and I have a busy course load but I regret it. I wanted to actually LEARN as well. Her lectures aren't relevant and have a white feminist moderate tone. If you want to learn this subject- choose elsewise.

Professor Kemp is a caring and respectful teacher. She does not grade harshly and she gives you multiple attempts on quizzes/tests. Her lectures are interesting, but rarely have anything to do with the class content. She doesn't use her powerpoints and often goes off on tangents. You have to teach yourself the content at home.

Dr Kemp was not originally supposed to teach this class, she was thrown into it a week before the semester, so I will give her credit for that. However, she makes attendance mandatory but everything is able to be done online and the lectures felt like a waste of time. Unclear/ didn't follow rubric, lack of clarity.
Amazing prof!!! always answered email in a timely manner and was clearly very knowledgeable of the subject. Was very clear on due dates and schedules.

I wish there were more professors like Ms. Kemp. She has some of the best lectures and makes the mandatory attendance worth it. Shes extremely flexible with every student and she just wants to see you succeed. The class has 10 quizzes, 3 exams, super easy group project, and an optional final.

If you can, take her!! I had Professor Kemp last year for Human Development & had her again for Psychology of Gender by chance. I love her class structure; if you do the quizzes & study them, you will for sure get an A on the tests. Class is primarily lectures & class discussions, and you don't really need the textbook too.
She is very kind and communicative with students. Easy A with minimal effort. Glad I could take her! Would def recommend!

I liked this class. Her lectures were entertaining. The quizzes could be taken as many times as you'd like before the due date, and when I missed a due date she reopened them for me. The tests were just like the quizzes so easy to study for. One group project but it wasn't too hard and she gave us a great grade when are presentation wasn't the best

Great professor, love her sense of humor, she can keep the students engaged and interested! She is extremely knowledgeable and her personal experience in the industry really enhances her teaching, she has a lot of stories and examples to provide for each topic. She is also very caring and accessible if you need help. Class was pretty easy.

I took Professor Kemp last summer for Theories of Personality and she is honestly the best professor I have taken at KSU! She makes sure to make her classes as stress-free and filled with learning opportunities as possible. She is very approachable and goes out of her way to help you will anything that may come up. TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!!

I honestly LOVE Ms. Kemp! She is amazing, Ms. Kemp if you ever see this thank you! You have showed me a that there are some wonderful professors out all around! If you communicate and update Ms. Kemp she gives points! I would take her again! Her class & the classmates I had were amazing!!!!!!! I recommend her nobody else! :) Once again thank you!

Super easy class. Study kahoots like the night before and youll get a 100 on every test. Group project was done in class only until corona. This is also why class is kind of mandatory bc you dont really know when the mandatory class days are. Super easy project I spent like 45 minutes in total on my part and got a 100.

Most amazing professor I have had at Kennesaw. She clearly states what she wants and gives you a cahoot before every test. One project all semester that is actually interesting and not too hard in difficulty. If you have a choice 100% take her for a good grade. Save you the stress and your GPA

TAKE HER!! For social psych she gives us quizzes before the test that 100% prep you for the test. Discussion posts are graded very simply and making a B is harder than making an A. I hear other professors are much harder so take this one!! Easiest class I'v had, but I learned alot so all over win.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Kemp is seriously the best Professor at Kennesaw. If you have the chance to take her, do it! You will not regret it!!! Amazing lectures, and she makes everything interesting! 4 tests that she completely prepares you for and then a group project as the final!

Professor Kemp is the BEST. Her human development class is by far one of the easiest classes you will take and you will learn a lot. Her kahoots are the actual tests, so you do not need to study. Besides the tests, your only other grade is a big group project. Overall, this class is low stress and an easy A.

She is amazing, great lectures, one group project at the end of the year. The test are extremely easy. DO THE REVIEWS and you will have no trouble passing. attendance is mandatory but her class is very interesting so you want to show up anyway
Take her!!! 4 tests and 1 group project

Professor Kemp is really nice and laid back she doesnt want to stress her students more than they already are so the class is easy and interesting. Her test are not hard at all, she uses Kahoot! as an study guide which has all the questions on the exam. Overall, she down-to-earth too and I would take another class by her.

Kemp is AWESOME! I loved having her this semester. Her tests really aren't hard at all, I never got anything below a 95. Her reviews for tests are extremely simple to learn and I can promise you'll do fine in this class if you take her. She's a very warm and caring person and appreciates participation during lectures; they're fun to be a part of!!

Professor Kemp is the way to go. She has interesting lectures and loves feedback and engaging students. All you have to do is show up everyday, interact in class, and use her review tool to ace the class. I would recommend her all day long!
